title: Drawing, "Pilaster strips"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Left row: A trellis candelabrum rising from a base between two birds. In the center is a vertical oblong frame with a statue; on top is a horizontal oblong. In the intervals are two lozenges. In the upper one is a bird upon a rope. Central row: in the center is an ovoid with a landscape, framed by moldings. Above and below are receding oblongs with convex edges below and above, respectively. They are decorated with acanthus rinceaux with animals. Right row: the upper part fo a similar scheme is shown. In the field above the ovoid are lions, crouching, supporting a trophy of arms.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Pilaster strips".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1470.
